Class Point

java.lang.Object
  geometri.Shape
      geometri.Point
All Implemented Interfaces:
GeometricalForm, java.lang.Comparable<GeometricalForm>
public class Point
extends Shape

A class describing a single point.

Author:
Johan Brook and Robin Andersson

Method Detail

area

public int area()
Compute the area of this form rounded to closest integer.

Returns:
The area for a Point is 0 (zero).

compareTo

public int compareTo(GeometricalForm f)
The method compareTo compares the area of the forms to decide if the given geometrical form is less or greater than this object. If they have the same area, the perimeter decides.

Parameters:
f - The geometrical form to compare with.
Returns:
An integer smaller than 0 if this form is smaller than the form given as argument, 0 if the sizes are equal, and a positive integer otherwise.

fill

public void fill(java.awt.Graphics g)

Draw a point.

Fill the forms area at the forms position with the forms color.

Parameters:
g - A graphic pen to draw with.

perimeter

public int perimeter()
Compute the perimeter of this form rounded to closest integer.

Returns:
The perimeter of a Point is 0 (zero).
